intro: Paepalanthus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian lantern plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette of sword-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces striking red or orange inflorescences that resemble lanterns, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
